projects.description: An app that effortlessly presents you with a curated Disney quote at random. You have the choice to either click the 'Show another quote' button for immediate access to a new quote, or simply relax as the page automatically refreshes itself. A built-in timer ensures a fresh quote graces your screen every 10 seconds, while the background color transitions to a new, random hue with each quote's appearance.

With a dataset of 42 students, I used pagination to create an interactive 'paging' system, allowing users to effortlessly explore and view student information across multiple pages. I also incorporated a search feature, enabling users to seamlessly filter through the student data.
An app that uses JavaScript to enhance an interactive registration form for a fictional Full Stack conference.
An app that uses JavaScript and OOP (Object-Oriented Programming) to select a random, hidden phrase, which a player tries to guess, by clicking letters on an onscreen keyboard.
An app that uses the Random User Generator API (https://randomuser.me/) to grab information for 12 random 'employees' and uses that data to build a prototype for an employee directory.
